artist: Artist: Utagawa Kunisada; Publisher: Iseya Kanekichi; Carver: Yokogawa Takejirō
creditline: Bequest of Louis W. Hill, Jr.
description: portrait of man with blueish skin, seen from PL with head turned toward picture plane; wrists crossed; man wears grey kimono and is bent forward; rainy landscape at top with white blossoming trees; pink square cartouche and red rectangular cartouche, both with text, in URC
inscription: {Yo no naka ni / taete sakura no / nakariseba / haru no kokoro wa / nodokekaramashi} (If there is no cherry blossoms / in the world / we would have spent springtime / with much more pieceful state of mind)
markings: date seal: 子十 {ne jū} (Rat 10) | censor seals: 福 {Fuku} | 村松 {Muramatsu} | publisher\'s seal: {Isekane} | carver\'s seal: 横川彫竹 {Yokogawa hori Take}
medium: Woodblock print (nishiki-e); ink and color on paper
portfolio: From The Visual Parody of the Thirty-Six Selected Poets (Mitate sanjūrokkasen no uchi 見立三十六歌撰之内)
signed: in toshidama cartouche: 豊國画 {Toyokuni ga}
title: Poem by Ariwara no Narihira Ason: (Actor Ichikawa Danjūrō VIII as) Seigen
